elements.2211.03158_5ad0aa08b4b68c5d3749dbc3832e1: We highlight certain key achievements in experimental work on molecular, colloidal and granular glassformers
elements.2211.03158_c64aaf02a1f7c13091057facc870f: This short review considers these three classes of experimental systems and focusses largely on the work of the authors and their coworkers and thus is far from exhaustive
elements.2211.03158_f3e18c65d9677c79ca357962d8d33: Our goal is rather to discuss particular experimental results from these classes and to explore universality and specificity across the broad range of length
elements.2211.03158_d3b53f17068c03a95e05f6922eb59: We emphasize that a variety of phenomena, not least dynamical heterogeneity, growing lengthscales and a change in structure, albeit subtle, are now well established in these three classes of glassformer
elements.2211.03158_03595f37d1499a250a35bb1ec3a89: We then review some experimental measurements which depend more specifically on the class of glassformer, such as the Gardner transition and some which have been investigated more in one or two classes than in all, such as configurational entropy and evidence for a dynamical phase transition
elements.2211.03158_115fbe1e02fbfd9abff757a03d5c3: We finally put forward some open questions and consider what could be done to fill some of the gaps between theoretical approaches and experiments.

elements.2211.03158_49db8074b92babf9049298170f92e: By focussing on our own work, we make what may be thought of as a first step towards exploring universal behaviour across these classes of system

elements.2211.03158_8e09558e989c70a6e83f0b93e80f8: Scientific questions opened by the glass transition
elements.2211.03158_43f56897fc965f9a4fb279d2adb72: We start by briefly outlining the scientific questions that the experimental studies we review are intended to address, referring the reader to more detailed reviews as appropriate, starting with a general review of the glass transition
elements.2211.03158_6535a5e4d56f790226ff272fc3aed: It is a basic tenet of materials science that the macroscopic properties of a material are, ultimately, encoded in its structure at the microscopic level
elements.2211.03158_0e5e523ecb54a86f6f89115b70cce: Glassforming systems challenge this viewpoint, as their microscopic structure, when characterized by the pair correlation function, exhibits very little change upon approaching the glass transition; yet they are as solid as any conventional crystalline solid
elements.2211.03158_b3a447c6e9f6bb11e0c46ef03e972: order correlation functions may better characterize the structural evolution in supercooled liquids approaching the glass transition
elements.2211.03158_8315456be3d7358eb6ff0a37564fa: , there remains the more profound question of what actually leads liquids to solidify without crystallising
elements.2211.03158_1d3e403c262ea3fa730efc91c7597: Indeed, it has been said that
elements.2211.03158_180f4d490f92d665ecf8841a76ebb: there are more theories of the glass transition than there are theorists who propose them
elements.2211.03158_91336e95978a5f59e4b5f48b409ab: From the experimental perspective that we pursue here, the challenge boils down to (i) identifying those theoretical approaches which correctly describes the experimental observations and (ii) proposing new experimental observations, which allow for a better discrimination amongst existing theories
